Effect: Seedpod.name: Effect: Seedpod
Effect: Seedpod.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.dWGa6cFSVrASTEfd]

On a critical hit, a seedpod bursts, issuing forth a tangle of vegetation that imposes a -10-foot circumstance penalty on the target's Speed for 1 round.

Effect: Shadow Blood Magic (Perception).name: Effect: Shadow Blood Magic (Perception)
Effect: Shadow Blood Magic (Perception).description: Shadows grow deeper around you or one target, imposing a -1 status penalty to Perception for 1 round.

Effect: Shadow Blood Magic (Stealth).name: Effect: Shadow Blood Magic (Stealth)
Effect: Shadow Blood Magic (Stealth).description: Shadows grow deeper around you or one target, granting a +1 status bonus to Stealth for 1 round.

Effect: Share Rage.name: Effect: Share Rage
Effect: Share Rage.description:
You tap into your inner fury and begin raging. You gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to your level plus your Constitution modifier. This frenzy lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies you can perceive, or until you fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf], whichever comes first. You can't voluntarily stop raging. While you are raging:

  • You deal 2 additional damage with melee weapons and unarmed attacks. This additional damage is halved if your weapon or unarmed attack is agile.
  • You take a -1 penalty to AC.

After you stop raging, you lose any remaining temporary Hit Points from Rage, and you can't Rage again for 1 minute.

Effect: Shared Avoidance.name: Effect: Shared Avoidance
Effect: Shared Avoidance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.wIJC00ODLq9WYc1m].

Allies within 15 feet of you who are rolling the same saving throw against the same hazard also gain a +2 circumstance bonus to their saving throws.

Effect: Shared Clarity.name: Effect: Shared Clarity
Effect: Shared Clarity.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.ybrx1nsg5J0L8d3j].

Allies within 15 feet of you who failed the same saving throw against the same mental effect can also spend their reactions to reroll the failed saving throw with a +2 circumstance bonus.

Effect: Shed Tail.name: Effect: Shed Tail
Effect: Shed Tail.description: You take a -2 circumstance penalty on checks to Balance.

Effect: Shield Ally.name: Effect: Shield Ally
Effect: Shield Ally.description: The hardness of your equipped shield increases by 2.

Effect: Skillful Mentor Boon (PFS).name: Effect: Skillful Mentor Boon (PFS)
Effect: Skillful Mentor Boon (PFS).description:
Effect While working with less experienced Pathfinder allies, you provide vital advice to sharpen your newer colleagues' skills. For any PCs benefiting from a Level Bump and whose levels are lower than yours, you increase the Level Bump's modifier to skill checks to 2.

Normal A Level Bump increases a PC's skill check modifiers by 1.

Special A PC can only benefit from two mentor boons.

Effect: Smite Evil.name: Effect: Smite Evil
Effect: Smite Evil.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.xgvKXeTxns0gIdAn].

Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes with the weapon your blade ally inhabits against that foe deal an extra 4 good damage, increasing to 6 if you have master proficiency with this weapon.

If the foe attacks one of your allies, the duration extends to the end of that foe's next turn. If the foe continues to attack your allies each turn, the duration continues to extend.

Effect: Smite Good.name: Effect: Smite Good
Effect: Smite Good.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.T5xFirAE8VLL5Lbu].

Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes against that foe using the weapon your blade ally inhabits deal an extra 4 evil damage, increasing to 6 if you have master proficiency with this weapon.

If the chosen enemy attacks you before the start of your next turn, the duration extends to the end of that enemy's next turn. If the enemy continues to attack you each turn, the duration continues to extend.

Effect: Sniping Duo Dedication.name: Effect: Sniping Duo Dedication
Effect: Sniping Duo Dedication.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.6PP57Aa5HmSr0qIZ].

Whenever you or your spotter successfully Strikes a target, the other member of your duo gains a +1 circumstance bonus per weapon damage die on the damage roll of their next Strike made against that target before the end of their next turn.

Effect: Soaring Flight.name: Effect: Soaring Flight
Effect: Soaring Flight.description: To be a tengu is to be unburdened by the concerns of the world below. You grow a pair of magical wings or expand your existing ones. For 5 minutes, you gain a fly Speed equal to your land Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

Effect: Spin Tale.name: Effect: Spin Tale
Effect: Spin Tale.description: You gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and saving throws against the villain until the start of your next turn.

Effect: Spiral Sworn.name: Effect: Spiral Sworn
Effect: Spiral Sworn.description: For 3 rounds, your Strikes and spells deal additional damage against undead, creatures in possession of an imprisoned soul, or creatures you have witnessed create or command undead. You gain a status bonus to damage with your Strikes against these creatures equal to the number of weapon damage dice. Spells you cast from spell slots gain a status bonus to damage against these creatures equal to the level of the spell; this bonus applies only to spells that deal damage and don't have a duration.

Effect: Starlight Armor.name: Effect: Starlight Armor
Effect: Starlight Armor.description:
The armor grants you resistance 7 to piercing, bludgeoning, and slashing damage. The armor also sheds bright light for 20 feet (and dim light for the next 20 feet).

When you reach 17th level, the resistance increases to 10.

Effect: Strained Metabolism.name: Effect: Strained Metabolism
Effect: Strained Metabolism.description:
Your body's overclocked physiology requires larger-than-usual amounts of nourishment, leaving you weakened when it kicks in mid-combat.

Mild Backlash Your metabolism immediately burns through your body's energy stores, making you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until you take a bite of food (which usually requires 2 Interact actions: one to retrieve the food and another to consume it).

Moderate Backlash Ravenous hunger wracks your body. You are enfeebled 1, clumsy 1, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw] until you can eat a full meal, which requires at least 10 minutes.

Severe Backlash The strain on your body is truly incapacitating. You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} as nausea wracks you, and you are also enfeebled 1 and clumsy 1 until you can eat a full meal (which requires you to no longer be sickened). You are fatigued until you can get a full night's rest.

Effect: Supercharge Prosthetic Eyes.name: Effect: Supercharge Prosthetic Eyes
Effect: Supercharge Prosthetic Eyes.description: You gain darkvision and low-light vision, and you gain a +1 status bonus to visual Perception checks.

Effect: Tactical Debilitations (No Flank.name: Effect: Tactical Debilitations (No Flanking)
Effect: Tactical Debilitations (No Flank.description: The target can't flank or contribute to allies' flanking.

Effect: Tail Toxin.name: Effect: Tail Toxin
Effect: Tail Toxin.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.ev8OHpBO3xq3Zt08]

You apply your tail's venom to a piercing or slashing weapon. If your next Strike with that weapon before the end of your next turn hits and deals damage, you deal persistent poison damage equal to your level to the target.

Effect: Tidal Shield.name: Effect: Tidal Shield
Effect: Tidal Shield.description: You conjure the force of the tides to gain a +4 circumstance bonus to AC until the end of your next turn. You can Sustain the effect to a maximum duration of 5 rounds.

Effect: Tiller's Drive.name: Effect: Tiller's Drive
Effect: Tiller's Drive.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Wo0HNBh6CCgPN3Co]

Members of your crop receive a +5-foot circumstance bonus to Speed.

Effect: Topple Giants.name: Effect: Topple Giants
Effect: Topple Giants.description: When an ally within your overwatch field attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731], or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP] an opponent within your overwatch field and fails, you coordinate efforts to provide a +2 circumstance bonus to the next Athletics check rolled by a different ally to attempt the same action on the same target before that target's next turn.

Effect: Treat Wounds Immunity.name: Effect: Treat Wounds Immunity
Effect: Treat Wounds Immunity.description: Granted when someone uses @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9] on you, rendering you temporarily immune to Treat Wounds for the duration.

Effect: Twin Parry.name: Effect: Twin Parry
Effect: Twin Parry.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Y8LHfkzGyOhPlUou] if neither weapon has the parry trait.

You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn.

Effect: Twin Parry (Parry Trait).name: Effect: Twin Parry (Parry Trait)
Effect: Twin Parry (Parry Trait).description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Y8LHfkzGyOhPlUou] if either weapon has the parry trait.

You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn.

Effect: Underground Endemic Herbs.name: Effect: Underground Endemic Herbs
Effect: Underground Endemic Herbs.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.BQzExsEZrwGsJD66]

Gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception.

Effect: Undying Conviction.name: Effect: Undying Conviction
Effect: Undying Conviction.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.xSYkYRKlSyLzPrH1]

Undead creatures gain a +2 status bonus to saving throws to resist positive damage and to Will saving throws to resist effects that would make them controlled.

Effect: Unleash Psyche.name: Effect: Unleash Psyche
Effect: Unleash Psyche.description: When you cast a damaging spell, you gain a status bonus to its damage equal to double the spell's level. This applies only to spells that don't have a duration and that you cast using psychic spellcasting.

Effect: Vicious Debilitations.name: Effect: Vicious Debilitations
Effect: Vicious Debilitations.description: The target gains weakness 5 to your choice of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage.

Effect: Victorious Vigor.name: Effect: Victorious Vigor
Effect: Victorious Vigor.description: You gain temporary Hit Points equal to your Constitution modifier until the end of your next turn.

Effect: Walking the Cardinal Paths.name: Effect: Walking the Cardinal Paths
Effect: Walking the Cardinal Paths.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.GpT5RXUwhINODqkJ]{(Affinity Ablaze) Arms of Balance: Walking the Cardinal Paths}

One of your weapons or your unarmed Strikes deal an additional 2d6 fire, cold, acid, or electricity damage. The Strikes gain the appropriate energy trait as well.

Effect: Watchful Gaze.name: Effect: Watchful Gaze
Effect: Watchful Gaze.description: You gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.9qV49KjZujZnSp6w] until the start of your next turn. This lets you see in all directions and prevents you from being flanked.

Effect: Weapon Tampered With (Critical S.name: Effect: Weapon Tampered With (Critical Success)
Effect: Weapon Tampered With (Critical S.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.SheifYobjKqyK3Fv]

Your weapon has been tampered with! You take a -2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls and damage rolls with that weapon. The effect lasts until you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F] to remove it.

Effect: Weapon Tampered With (Success).name: Effect: Weapon Tampered With (Success)
Effect: Weapon Tampered With (Success).description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.SheifYobjKqyK3Fv]

Your weapon has been tampered with! You take a -2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls and damage rolls with that weapon. The effect ends at the start of the inventor's next turn, or until you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F] to remove it.

Effect: Wings of Air.name: Effect: Wings of Air
Effect: Wings of Air.description: You can strain to call forth feathered or cloudy wings from your back. Once manifested, these wings remain for 10 minutes. You gain a fly Speed equal to your land Speed while you've manifested your wings.

Effect: Witch's Charge.name: Effect: Witch's Charge
Effect: Witch's Charge.description: Granted when you designate someone as your @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.52QyoGaysrfBOy5H].

Effect: Worldly Mentor Boon (PFS).name: Effect: Worldly Mentor Boon (PFS)
Effect: Worldly Mentor Boon (PFS).description:
Effect While working with less experienced Pathfinder allies, you help your less experienced colleagues recognize danger and withstand danger. For any PCs benefiting from a Level Bump and whose levels are lower than yours, you increase the Level Bump's modifier to Perception checks and Initiative rolls to 2.

Normal A Level Bump increases a PC's Perception modifier by 1.

Special A PC can only benefit from two mentor boons.

Effect: Wyrmblessed Blood Magic (Status.name: Effect: Wyrmblessed Blood Magic (Status Bonus - Self)
Effect: Wyrmblessed Blood Magic (Status.description: Draconic might carries in your voice. You gain a +1 status bonus to Intimidation checks for 1 round.

Effect: Wyrmblessed Blood Magic (Status.name: Effect: Wyrmblessed Blood Magic (Status Penalty - Target)
Effect: Wyrmblessed Blood Magic (Status.description: Draconic might carries in your voice. A target takes a -1 status penalty to Will saves for 1 round.

Effect: You're an Embarrassment.name: Effect: You're an Embarrassment
Effect: You're an Embarrassment.description: You reroll the triggering Will saving throw with a +1 circumstance bonus.

Favored Terrain (Gain Climb Speed).name: Favored Terrain (Gain Climb Speed)
Favored Terrain (Gain Climb Speed).description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.sgo7J9BVofBqwlsF]{Favored Terrain (Forest, Moutain or Underground)} if you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.RlwE99yKnhq8FUuy] class feature, and are in forested, mountainous or underground terrain and do not already have a climb Speed.

You gain a climb Speed equal to your Speed.

Favored Terrain (Gain Swim Speed).name: Favored Terrain (Gain Swim Speed)
Favored Terrain (Gain Swim Speed).description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.sgo7J9BVofBqwlsF]{Favored Terrain (Aquatic)} if you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.RlwE99yKnhq8FUuy] class feature, and are in aquatic terrain and do not already have a swim Speed.

You gain a swim Speed equal to your Speed.

Favored Terrain (Increase Climb Speed).name: Favored Terrain (Increase Climb Speed)
Favored Terrain (Increase Climb Speed).description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.sgo7J9BVofBqwlsF]{Favored Terrain (Forest, Moutain or Underground)} if you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.RlwE99yKnhq8FUuy] class feature, and are in forested, mountainous or underground terrain and already have a climb Speed.

You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your climb Speed.

Favored Terrain (Increase Swim Speed).name: Favored Terrain (Increase Swim Speed)
Favored Terrain (Increase Swim Speed).description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.sgo7J9BVofBqwlsF]{Favored Terrain (Aquatic)} if you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.RlwE99yKnhq8FUuy] class feature, and are in aquatic terrain and already have a swimSpeed.

You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your swim Speed.

Goblin Song (Critical Success).name: Goblin Song (Critical Success)
Goblin Song (Critical Success).description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.QZb0Utg0WFPf2Qg0]

The creature takes a -1 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves.

Goblin Song (Success).name: Goblin Song (Success)
Goblin Song (Success).description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.QZb0Utg0WFPf2Qg0]

The creature takes a -1 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves.

Stance: Arcane Cascade.name: Stance: Arcane Cascade
Stance: Arcane Cascade.description:
Requirements You used your most recent action to Cast a Spell or make a Spellstrike.

You divert a portion of the spell's magical power and keep it cycling through your body and weapon using specialized forms, breathing, or footwork. While you're in the stance, your melee Strikes deal [[/r {1}]]{1 extra damage}. This damage increases to 2 if you have weapon specialization and 3 if you have greater weapon specialization. Any Strike that benefits from this damage gains the arcane trait, making it magical.

If your most recent spell before entering the stance was one that can deal damage, the damage from the stance is the same type that spell could deal (or one type of your choice if the spell could deal multiple types of damage). If the spell couldn't deal damage, this stance's bonus damage depends on the spell's school.

  • Abjuration or Evocation force
  • Conjuration or Transmutation same type as your weapon or unarmed attack
  • Divination, Enchantment, or Illusion mental
  • Necromancy negative

Stance: Buckler Dance.name: Stance: Buckler Dance
Stance: Buckler Dance.description:
Granted by: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.tDWc2LQNl0Op1Auq]

Requirements You are wielding a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.1k3AsSW7lpU0kEpY].

You spin your buckler defensively toward every attack. While you are in this stance, you constantly have your buckler raised as if you'd used @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.xjGwis0uaC2305pm], as long as you meet that action's requirements.

Stance: Bullet Dancer Stance.name: Stance: Bullet Dancer Stance
Stance: Bullet Dancer Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SMF1hTWPHtmlS8Cd]

Requirements You're unarmored and wielding a simple firearm, bayonet, or reinforced stock

Effect You enter a specialized stance for a unique martial art centered around the use of simple firearms. While in this stance, the only Strikes you can make are those using bayonets, reinforced stocks, and simple firearms. You can use Flurry of Blows with these weapons. You can use your other monk feats or monk abilities that normally require unarmed attacks with bayonets and reinforced stocks, so long as the feat or ability doesn't require a single, specific Strike. You can also use them with simple firearms when attacking within half the first range increment.

Stance: Clinging Shadows Stance.name: Stance: Clinging Shadows Stance
Stance: Clinging Shadows Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.uJXs4M6IeixfPBLc]

You adopt the stance of clinging shadows. You can make shadow grasp Strikes. These deal 1d4 negative damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, grapple, reach, and unarmed traits.

While in the clinging shadows stance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD], and to the DC for creatures to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9] from you.

Stance: Cobra Stance.name: Stance: Cobra Stance
Stance: Cobra Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.AkV4Jyllo6nlK2Sl]

You enter a tight stance, coiled up like a lashing cobra with your hands poised as venomous fangs. While in this stance, the only Strikes you can make are cobra fang unarmed attacks. These deal 1d4 poison damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, deadly d10, finesse, nonlethal, poison, and unarmed traits.

While in Cobra Stance, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves and your Fortitude DC, and you gain poison resistance equal to half your level.

Stance: Cobra Stance (Cobra Envenom).name: Stance: Cobra Stance (Cobra Envenom)
Stance: Cobra Stance (Cobra Envenom).description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.AkV4Jyllo6nlK2Sl] if you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.xQuNswWB3eg1UM28], which increases the circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves and Fortitude DC to +2.

You enter a tight stance, coiled up like a lashing cobra with your hands poised as venomous fangs. While in this stance, the only Strikes you can make are cobra fang unarmed attacks. These deal 1d4 poison damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, deadly d10, finesse, nonlethal, poison, and unarmed traits.

While in Cobra Stance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves and your Fortitude DC, and you gain poison resistance equal to half your level.

Stance: Crane Stance.name: Stance: Crane Stance
Stance: Crane Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.bf7NCeKqDClaqhTR]

You enter the stance of a crane, holding your arms in an imitation of a crane's wings and using flowing, defensive motions. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC, but the only Strikes you can make are crane wing attacks. These deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, finesse, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

While in Crane Stance, reduce the DC for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2] by 5, and when you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.d5I6018Mci2SWokk], you can move an additional 5 feet horizontally or 2 feet vertically.

Stance: Devrin's Cunning Stance.name: Stance: Devrin's Cunning Stance
Stance: Devrin's Cunning Stance.description: Your aura grants you and your allies a +1 status bonus to skill checks. When you or an ally in the aura Strike a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg] enemy, that enemy can't use reactions until the beginning of its next turn.

Stance: Disarming Stance.name: Stance: Disarming Stance
Stance: Disarming Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.1p5ErCp33nGOzEsk].

You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to Disarm and a +2 circumstance bonus to your Reflex DC when defending against checks to Disarm you.

Stance: Disruptive Stance.name: Stance: Disruptive Stance
Stance: Disruptive Stance.description:
Granted by: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.OEGhbRgW6wRbccns]

The slightest distraction can provoke your wrath, and you're prepared to foil enemies' actions.

As long as you are in this stance, you can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.KAVf7AmRnbCAHrkT] when a creature within your reach uses a concentrate action, in addition to manipulate and move actions.

Furthermore, you disrupt a triggering concentrate or manipulate action if your Strike hits (not only if it's a critical hit).

Stance: Dragon Stance.name: Stance: Dragon Stance
Stance: Dragon Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.8sy3sHwOHS4ImwvJ]

You enter the stance of a dragon and make powerful leg strikes like a lashing dragon's tail. You can make dragon tail attacks that deal 1d10 bludgeoning damage. They are in the brawling group and have the backswing, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

While in Dragon Stance, you can ignore the first square of difficult terrain while Striding.

Stance: Dread Marshal Stance.name: Stance: Dread Marshal Stance
Stance: Dread Marshal Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.R7c4PyTNkZb0yvoT].

Your marshal's aura grants you and allies a status bonus to damage rolls equal to the number of weapon damage dice of the unarmed attack or weapon the you are wielding that has the most weapon damage dice. When you or an ally in the aura critically hits an enemy with a Strike, that enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Stance: Everstand Stance.name: Stance: Everstand Stance
Stance: Everstand Stance.description: When in this stance, you wield the shield with both hands. When wielding a shield this way, increase the weapon damage die of the shield's boss or spikes by one step, and increase the shield's Hardness by 2 when using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.jM72TjJ965jocBV8] reaction.

Stance: Fane's Fourberie.name: Stance: Fane's Fourberie
Stance: Fane's Fourberie.description:
Granted by: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.80CEAB05TP5ki9iW]

Stella Fane has perfected a technique for using playing cards as weapons that's one part sleight of hand and one part magic.

When you enter this stance, choose whether to treat playing cards in your possession as daggers or darts; you can wield a playing card in all ways as the chosen weapon until the stance ends. As long as the majority of the deck remains in your possession, any cards that are lost or thrown can be found after 1 minute. Otherwise, the remaining cards are likely lost or destroyed.

A character who has this feat can enchant a single deck of playing cards as a magic weapon, etching fundamental and property runes directly onto the deck of cards.

Stance: Gorilla Stance.name: Stance: Gorilla Stance
Stance: Gorilla Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.DqD7htz8Sd1dh3BT]

You lower yourself to the ground and take an imposing, knuckle-walking stance. While in this stance, the only Strikes you can make are gorilla slam unarmed attacks. These deal 1d8 bludgeoning damage; are in the brawling group; and have the backswing, forceful, grapple, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

While you are in Gorilla Stance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy], and if you roll a success on an Athletics check to Climb, you get a critical success instead.

Stance: Gorilla Stance (Gorilla Pound).name: Stance: Gorilla Stance (Gorilla Pound)
Stance: Gorilla Stance (Gorilla Pound).description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.DqD7htz8Sd1dh3BT] if you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.nRjyyDulHnP5OewA], which grants you a climb speed of 15 while you are in this stance.

You lower yourself to the ground and take an imposing, knuckle-walking stance. While in this stance, the only Strikes you can make are gorilla slam unarmed attacks. These deal 1d8 bludgeoning damage; are in the brawling group; and have the backswing, forceful, grapple, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

While you are in Gorilla Stance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy], and if you roll a success on an Athletics check to Climb, you get a critical success instead.

Stance: Graceful Poise.name: Stance: Graceful Poise
Stance: Graceful Poise.description:
Granted by: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.rFaUJtB46scuAidY]

With the right positioning, your off-hand weapon can strike like a scorpion's stinger.

While you are in this stance, if you make your second Strike from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.onde0SxLoxLBTnvm] with an agile weapon, Double Slice counts as one attack when calculating your multiple attack penalty.

Stance: Impassable Wall Stance.name: Stance: Impassable Wall Stance
Stance: Impassable Wall Stance.description:
Granted by: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.YeyOqNFKaeuOTiJr]

You refuse to let foes past your guard. As long as you are in this stance, when you critically hit with an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.KAVf7AmRnbCAHrkT] triggered by a move action, you disrupt that move action.

Stance: Inspiring Marshal Stance.name: Stance: Inspiring Marshal Stance
Stance: Inspiring Marshal Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.bvOsJNeI0ewvQsFa].

Your marshal's aura grants you and allies a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and saves against mental effects.

Stance: Ironblood Stance.name: Stance: Ironblood Stance
Stance: Ironblood Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.x9cYkB8DrUBBwqJd]

You enter the stance of impenetrable iron, refusing to yield to any blow. You can make iron sweep unarmed attacks. These deal 1d8 bludgeoning damage; are in the brawling group; and have the nonlethal, parry, sweep, and unarmed traits.

While in Ironblood Stance, you gain resistance 2 to all damage. The resistance increases to 3 at 12th level, to 4 at 16th level, and to 5 at 20th level.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.fRlvmul3LbLo2xvR]

Stance: Jellyfish Stance.name: Stance: Jellyfish Stance
Stance: Jellyfish Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Jwq5o13uZF3ooln1]

Requirements You are unarmored.

You relax your posture and loosen your joints, allowing yourself to move with incredible fluidity. You can make stinging lash attacks that deal 1d6 slashing damage. These attacks are in the brawling group, and have the finesse, nonlethal, reach, and unarmed traits.

While in Jellyfish Stance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex saves and on checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt].

Stance: Lunging Stance.name: Stance: Lunging Stance
Stance: Lunging Stance.description:
Granted by: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.ZghzLmYgeE19GqjP]

Requirements You are wielding a melee weapon

Your body coiled to strike, you can lash out at distant enemies. While you are in this stance, you can use Attack of Opportunity against a creature that is outside your reach but within the reach you would have with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.rTkr1EqpAN6YtnAh]. If you do, you increase your range with the Strike by 5 feet.

Stance: Mobile Shot Stance.name: Stance: Mobile Shot Stance
Stance: Mobile Shot Stance.description:
Granted by: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.rByA8NDI6ZtNgBeT]

Your shots become nimble and deadly. While you're in this stance, your ranged Strikes don't trigger Attacks of Opportunity or other reactions that are triggered by a ranged attack.

If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.KAVf7AmRnbCAHrkT], you can use it with a loaded ranged weapon you're wielding. The triggering creature must be within 5 feet of you for you to do so.

Stance: Monastic Archer Stance.name: Stance: Monastic Archer Stance
Stance: Monastic Archer Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.YG2RxXE9SMfwo6wP]

You enter a specialized stance for a unique martial art centered around the use of a bow. While in this stance, the only Strikes you can make are those using longbows, shortbows, or bows with the monk trait.

You can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.nbfNETdpee8CVM17] with these bows. You can use your other monk feats or monk abilities that normally require unarmed attacks with these bows when attacking within half the first range increment (normally 50 feet for a longbow and 30 feet for a shortbow), so long as the feat or ability doesn't require a single, specific Strike.

Stance: Mountain Stance.name: Stance: Mountain Stance
Stance: Mountain Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.ZL5UU9quCTvcWzfY]

You enter the stance of an implacable mountainâ€”a technique first discovered by dwarven monksâ€”allowing you to strike with the weight of an avalanche. The only Strikes you can make are falling stone unarmed attacks. These deal 1d8 bludgeoning damage; are in the brawling group; and have the forceful, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

While in Mountain Stance, you gain a +4 item bonus to AC and a +2 circumstance bonus to any defenses against being Shoved or Tripped. However, you have a Dexterity modifier cap to your AC of +0, meaning you don't add your Dexterity to your AC, and your Speeds are all reduced by 5 feet. The item bonus to AC from Mountain Stance is cumulative with armor potency runes on your explorer's clothing, mage armor, and bracers of armor.

Stance: Multishot Stance.name: Stance: Multishot Stance
Stance: Multishot Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.RzhnxgiAopWILCvs].

While you are in this stance, your penalty for Double Shot is reduced to -1, or -2 if you add the extra action to make three Strikes. If you move from your position, this stance ends.

Stance: Paragon's Guard.name: Stance: Paragon's Guard
Stance: Paragon's Guard.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.hPDerDCYmag3s0dP].

Requirements You are wielding a shield

Once you've had a moment to set your stance, you always have your shield ready without a thought.

While you are in this stance, you constantly have your shield raised as if you'd used the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.xjGwis0uaC2305pm] action, as long as you meet that action's requirements.

Stance: Peafowl Stance.name: Stance: Peafowl Stance
Stance: Peafowl Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.C3MgEkPNaIhTddbr]

You enter a tall and proud stance while remaining mobile, with all the grace and composure of a peafowl.

While in this stance, the only Strikes you can make are melee Strikes with the required sword. Once per round, after you hit with a monk sword Strike, you can Step as a free action as your next action.

Stance: Point-Blank Shot.name: Stance: Point-Blank Shot
Stance: Point-Blank Shot.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Yl2wYv24v5kw95aS].

When using a ranged weapon that doesn't have the volley trait, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls on attacks against targets within the weapon's first range increment.

Stance: Powder Punch Stance.name: Stance: Powder Punch Stance
Stance: Powder Punch Stance.description:
Granted by: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Ziky4XVV7syXVbUg]

You infuse your handwraps with black powder. On your first melee Strike each round with an unarmed attack, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.dgXjUcaoQDAY6ZpO], or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.8eGV6fXbmt2v74uB], you deal an additional 1 fire Damage. If you critically succeed at an attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731] while in this stance, the target is pushed back an additional 5 feet.

Stance: Rain of Embers Stance.name: Stance: Rain of Embers Stance
Stance: Rain of Embers Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.rbiMK71SvGZGRLJ1]

You enter the stance of an enraged phoenix, holding your fingers as rigid as deadly talons while moving with quick, flickering gestures that dance with biting flames. The only Strikes you can make are fire talon Strikes. These deal 1d4 fire damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, finesse, fire, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

While in Rain of Embers Stance, you gain a +1 status bonus to AC and fire resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1).

Stance: Reflective Ripple Stance.name: Stance: Reflective Ripple Stance
Stance: Reflective Ripple Stance.description:
You can make flowing wave attacks that deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage. They are in the brawling group and have the agile, disarm, finesse, nonlethal, trip, unarmed, and water traits.

While in Reflective Ripple Stance, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx], or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP], and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Reflex DC to avoid being Disarmed and Tripped.

Stance: Ricochet Stance.name: Stance: Ricochet Stance
Stance: Ricochet Stance.description:
Granted by: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.tRHjUCl0xqG97nok] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.RsNvCSrCN7czHC0G]

You adopt a stance designed to rebound your thrown weapons back toward you. While you are in this stance, any thrown weapons you use as part of a ranged Strike to deal bludgeoning or slashing damage immediately return to your hand, enabling you to use them for additional Strikes.

You must be within the weapon's listed range increment and have a hand free to catch the weapon. If you make a ranged Strike with a thrown weapon outside of its listed range increment, it instead flies back toward you a number of feet equal to its listed range increment and then falls to the ground.

Stance: Rough Terrain Stance.name: Stance: Rough Terrain Stance
Stance: Rough Terrain Stance.description:
Granted by: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.O0POcPD2aELYTcIK]

Requirements You gained a terrain attunement benefit this turn.

You enter a stance that makes it difficult to move around you. Each square adjacent to you becomes difficult terrain that matches the terrain attunement you gained (rime forms in an arctic terrain, momentary undergrowth shoots up in a forest terrain, and so on). You ignore this difficult terrain.

This stance ends if you move into a different type of terrain.

Stance: Shooting Stars Stance.name: Stance: Shooting Stars Stance
Stance: Shooting Stars Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.6cQSPqXoAO6oJl0i]

You enter a stance that lets you throw shuriken with lightning speed.

While in this stance, you can use your monk feats or monk abilities that normally require unarmed attacks with shuriken instead.

Stance: Six Pillars Stance.name: Stance: Six Pillars Stance
Stance: Six Pillars Stance.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.hT0pVPqFuiEsmRb8]

Requirements You are unarmored.

You stand firm, steeling your mind and body, allowing you to use your magic unperturbed. While in this stance, you gain a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by using actions with the concentrate or manipulate traits. In addition, when you cast a spell that requires one or more actions while in this stance, your unarmed Strikes gain a +1 circumstance bonus to damage.

Stance: Sky and Heaven Stance.name: Stance: Sky and Heaven Stance
Stance: Sky and Heaven Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.UjEeHamC2C8JfgJz]

Your jagged blows are like lightning. The only Strikes you can make are skyward slash unarmed attacks. These unarmed attacks deal 1d10 slashing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the nonlethal, unarmed, and versatile P traits. While in Sky and Heaven Stance, you gain resistance 2 to electricity and resistance 2 to sonic damage. These resistances increase to 5 at 12th level and to 8 at 18th level.

Stance: Stoked Flame Stance.name: Stance: Stoked Flame Stance
Stance: Stoked Flame Stance.description:
Requirements You're unarmored.

You enter a stance of fast, fiery movements. You can make flashing spark attacks that deal 1d8 slashing damage. They are in the brawling group and have the forceful, nonlethal, sweep, and unarmed traits. If you have access to the flashing sparks' critical specialization effect, you can take an alternate effect instead: if your critical Strike dealt damage, the target takes 1d6 persistent fire damage.

While in Stoked Flame Stance, you gain a +5-foot status bonus to your Speed. If you have incredible movement, increase the benefit from incredible movement to a +15-foot status bonus plus 5 feet for every 4 levels beyond 3rd.

Special This feat gains your choice of either the divine or occult trait, matching your ki spell tradition if possible.

Stance: Stumbling Stance.name: Stance: Stumbling Stance
Stance: Stumbling Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.7FRYyKXDKjGoANYj]

You enter a seemingly unfocused stance that mimics the movements of the inebriatedâ€”bobbing, weaving, leaving false openings, and distracting your enemies from your true movements. While in this stance, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Deception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X].

The only Strikes you can make are stumbling swing unarmed attacks. These deal 1d8 bludgeoning damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, backstabber, finesse, nonlethal, and unarmed traits. If an enemy hits you with a melee Strike while in this stance, it becomes flat-footed against the next stumbling swing Strike you make against it before the end of your next turn.

Stance: Tangled Forest Stance.name: Stance: Tangled Forest Stance
Stance: Tangled Forest Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.2tUdsoPEnW9yS8so]

You extend your arms like gnarled branches to interfere with your foes' movements. You can make lashing branch unarmed attacks. These deal 1d8 slashing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, finesse, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

While you're in Tangled Forest Stance and can act, every enemy in your reach that tries to move away from you must succeed at a Reflex save, Acrobatics check, or Athletics check against your class DC or be immobilized for that action. If you prefer, you can allow the enemy to move.

Stance: Tiger Stance.name: Stance: Tiger Stance
Stance: Tiger Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.VCjAlOvjNvFJOsG5]

You enter the stance of a tiger and can make tiger claw attacks. These deal 1d8 slashing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, finesse, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

On a critical success with your tiger claws, if you deal damage, the target takes [[/r 1d4[bleed]]].

As long as your Speed is at least 20 feet while in Tiger Stance, you can Step 10 feet.

Stance: Twinned Defense.name: Stance: Twinned Defense
Stance: Twinned Defense.description:
Granted by: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.xjLbabfyQzBNT4y1] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.kTRGAST9J9ZxJZ4A]

Requirements You are wielding two melee weapons, one in each hand

You're always ready to use your off-hand weapon to interfere with attacks against you. While you are in this stance, you constantly gain the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Y8LHfkzGyOhPlUou] action.

Stance: Vitality-Manipulation Stance.name: Stance: Vitality-Manipulation Stance
Stance: Vitality-Manipulation Stance.description:
You have learned to attack meridians and pressure points like your rival Shino Hakusa. You gain a vitality blast ranged unarmed Strike that deals [[/r 1d4[negative]]] damage, has a range of 30 feet, and has the unarmed and versatile positive traits.

Additionally, when you use Stunning Fist, instead of saving against being stunned, you can choose to have the target make a Fortitude save against your class DC with the following results. You must choose to do this before the target rolls its save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target's muscles become temporarily weaker. For 1 round, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, and any time it attempts to take an action with the manipulate trait, the action is disrupted unless it succeeds at a flat check with a DC equal to 5 + its enfeebled value.

Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute.

Critical Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute, the flat check is DC 11, and the target takes -10-foot status penalty to all Speeds for the duration.

Stance: Whirling Blade Stance.name: Stance: Whirling Blade Stance
Stance: Whirling Blade Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.IaiEZaA8erufMUCr]

You enter a mindful stance that creates a deep connection between you and your monk weapons, allowing you to manipulate them with your ki even at a distance.

All melee Monk weapons you wield with the finesse trait gain the thrown 10 feet trait (unless they already have the thrown trait with a greater range).

Once you've made a thrown Strike with such a weapon, you can use the precision of your throw to make additional Strikes with it, even from a distance. Start from the space of the previous Strike's target to determine the range increment and whether the new target has cover. At the end of your turn, the thrown weapon flies directly back to you in a straight line. If a solid barrier blocks its path, it falls to the ground after hitting the barrier.

Stance: Whirlwind Stance.name: Stance: Whirlwind Stance
Stance: Whirlwind Stance.description:
Granted by: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.wZZyasfIqwiJBQAQ]

Requirements You are wielding your staff, which must have the parry trait.

You use your staff as a defensive implement as well as an offensive one. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC as long as you remain in this stance.

Stance: Wild Winds Stance.name: Stance: Wild Winds Stance
Stance: Wild Winds Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.SkarN4VlNxSJSJNw]

You take on the stance of the flowing winds, sending out waves of energy at a distance.

You can make wind crash unarmed Strikes as ranged Strikes against targets within 30 feet. These deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage, use the brawling group, and have the agile, nonlethal, propulsive, and unarmed traits. Wind crash Strikes ignore concealment and all cover.

While in wild winds stance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against ranged attacks.

Stance: Wolf Stance.name: Stance: Wolf Stance
Stance: Wolf Stance.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.AN9jY1JVcU20Qdw6]

You enter the stance of a wolf, low to the ground with your hands held like fanged teeth. You can make wolf jaw unarmed attacks. These deal 1d8 piercing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, backstabber, finesse, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

If you're flanking a target while in Wolf Stance, your wolf jaw unarmed attacks also gain the trip trait.
